entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Likely Through This Week... Warm temperatures across the eastern Interior, combined with a much above normal snowpack over higher elevations, is causing a significant increase in snowmelt. Runoff into rivers south of the Brooks Range is causing water levels to rise and breakup to begin on many rivers. Local ice jams may form and result in elevated

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels and Local Runoff Possible Next Week... entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 7:57AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: .Recent rainfall has combined with melting snow to raise water levels on the Sweetwater River. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Sweetwater River around Sweetwater Station will continue to run near or above bankfull, and low-land flooding near the river is likely through at least midweek. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT WEDNESDAY...
